answer: No

question: Circumstances under which an arrest record may be cleared (qualification requirements may be satisfied by different combinations of the criteria):
answer: A petition or request has been filed and accepted
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 9122. Expungement. [18 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 9122 (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-18/chapter-91/section-9122/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/Y9B7-68S4).

question: Circumstances under which an arrest record may be cleared (qualification requirements may be satisfied by different combinations of the criteria):
answer: The court has ordered or approved an expunction request
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 9122. Expungement. [18 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 9122 (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-18/chapter-91/section-9122/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/Y9B7-68S4).

question: Circumstances under which an arrest record may be cleared (qualification requirements may be satisfied by different combinations of the criteria):
answer: The state police central repository has not received a disposition for the case
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 9122. Expungement. [18 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 9122 (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-18/chapter-91/section-9122/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/Y9B7-68S4).

question: Circumstances under which an arrest record may be cleared (qualification requirements may be satisfied by different combinations of the criteria):
answer: The state police central repository did not record a disposition for the case within 18 months after the arrest, and the court confirms that no action is pending
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 9122. Expungement. [18 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 9122 (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-18/chapter-91/section-9122/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/Y9B7-68S4).

question: Circumstances under which an arrest record may be cleared (qualification requirements may be satisfied by different combinations of the criteria):
answer: The petitioner is at least 70 years old and has not been arrested or faced prosecution for at least 10 years following his or her final release from custody
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 9122. Expungement. [18 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 9122 (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-18/chapter-91/section-9122/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/Y9B7-68S4).

question: Circumstances under which an arrest record may be cleared (qualification requirements may be satisfied by different combinations of the criteria):
answer: The individual has been deceased for at least 3 years

question: Circumstances under which an arrest record may be cleared (qualification requirements may be satisfied by different combinations of the criteria):

answer: The individual has been deceased for at least 3 years
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 9122. Expungement. [18 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 9122(a)(3),(b) (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-18/chapter-91/section-9122/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/W6TC-ZB79).

question: Circumstances under which a conviction record may be cleared (qualification requirements may be satisfied by different combinations of the criteria):
answer: The petitioner has been free of arrest or prosecution for five years following the conviction for which expunction is sought
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 9122. Expungement. [18 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 9122(a)(3),(b) (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-18/chapter-91/section-9122/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/W6TC-ZB79).

question: Circumstances under which pardons may be granted:
answer: An application or petition has been submitted and accepted
citations: Pennsylvania Constitution. Article IV, section 9. Pardoning power; Board of Pardons. [P.A. Const. art. IV,  § 9](http://www.legis.state.pa.us/cfdocs/legis/LI/consCheck.cfm?txtType=HTM&ttl=00&div=0&chpt=4&sctn=9&subsctn=0). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/E378-WTNQ).

question: Circumstances under which pardons may be granted:
answer: Approval from the governor
citations: Pennsylvania Constitution. Article IV, section 9. Pardoning power; Board of Pardons. [P.A. Const. art. IV,  § 9](http://www.legis.state.pa.us/cfdocs/legis/LI/consCheck.cfm?txtType=HTM&ttl=00&div=0&chpt=4&sctn=9&subsctn=0). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/E378-WTNQ).

question: Circumstances under which pardons may be granted:
answer: Majority approval from the board of pardons
citations: Pennsylvania Constitution. Article IV, section 9. Pardoning power; Board of Pardons. [P.A. Const. art. IV,  § 9](http://www.legis.state.pa.us/cfdocs/legis/LI/consCheck.cfm?txtType=HTM&ttl=00&div=0&chpt=4&sctn=9&subsctn=0). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/E378-WTNQ).

question: Circumstances under which pardons may be granted:
answer: Unanimous approval from the board of pardons if a death sentence has been imposed and clemency counsel is sought
citations: Pennsylvania Constitution. Article IV, section 9. Pardoning power; Board of Pardons. [P.A. Const. art. IV,  § 9](http://www.legis.state.pa.us/cfdocs/legis/LI/consCheck.cfm?txtType=HTM&ttl=00&div=0&chpt=4&sctn=9&subsctn=0). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/E378-WTNQ).

question: Circumstances under which pardons may be granted:
answer: The offense for which clemency is sought is not a conviction resulting from impeachment
citations: Pennsylvania Constitution. Article IV, section 9. Pardoning power; Board of Pardons. [P.A. Const. art. IV,  § 9](http://www.legis.state.pa.us/cfdocs/legis/LI/consCheck.cfm?txtType=HTM&ttl=00&div=0&chpt=4&sctn=9&subsctn=0). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/E378-WTNQ).

question: Circumstances under which pardons may be granted:
answer: In the case of a sentence of death or life incarceration, a full hearing in open session must be held following due public notice
citations: Pennsylvania Constitution. Article IV, section 9. Pardoning power; Board of Pardons. [P.A. Const. art. IV,  § 9](http://www.legis.state.pa.us/cfdocs/legis/LI/consCheck.cfm?txtType=HTM&ttl=00&div=0&chpt=4&sctn=9&subsctn=0). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/E378-WTNQ).

question: Do expunged records appear in public record requests?
answer: Yes
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 9122. Expungement. [18 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 9122(e) (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-18/chapter-91/section-9122/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/WKB5-U3YS).

question: Individuals that may be compelled by state law to submit to DNA testing:
answer: Individuals convicted of any felony sex offense
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 2316. DNA sample required upon conviction, delinquency adjudication and certain ARD cases. [44 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 2316(a) (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-44/chapter-23/section-2316/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/5JMF-H7N7).

question: Individuals that may be compelled by state law to submit to DNA testing:
answer: Individuals accepted into the Accelerated Rehabilitative Disposition program as a result of a criminal charge for a felony sex offense
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 2316. DNA sample required upon conviction, delinquency adjudication and certain ARD cases. [44 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 2316(c) (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-44/chapter-23/section-2316/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/6U8P-QWZC).

question: Non-traffic offenses that can result in the suspension or revocation of a driver's license (suspension or revocation may be either mandatory or discretionary):
answer: Any felony involving a motor vehicle (mandatory)
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 1532. Suspension of operating privilege. [75 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 1532(a)(1) (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-75/chapter-15/section-1532/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/SB9J-3XK9).

question: Non-traffic offenses that can result in the suspension or revocation of a driver's license (suspension or revocation may be either mandatory or discretionary):
answer: Failure to pay child support (mandatory)
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 4355. Denial or suspension of licenses. [23 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 4355(a) (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-23/chapter-43/section-4355/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/7BGZ-S2FS).

question: Non-traffic offenses that can result in the suspension or revocation of a driver's license (suspension or revocation may be either mandatory or discretionary):
answer: Purchase of alcohol while under age 21 (mandatory)
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 1532. Suspension of operating privilege. [75 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 1532(c) (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-75/chapter-15/section-1532/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/Z3VH-VFLZ).

question: Non-traffic offenses that can result in the suspension or revocation of a driver's license (suspension or revocation may be either mandatory or discretionary):
answer: Offenses related to altering, forging or counterfeiting documents related to motor vehicles or license plates (mandatory)
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 1532. Suspension of operating privilege. [75 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 1532(a)(3) (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-75/chapter-15/section-1532/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/T9W4-U4RA).

question: Non-traffic offenses that can result in the suspension or revocation of a driver's license (suspension or revocation may be either mandatory or discretionary):
answer: Possession or sale of controlled substances (mandatory)
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 1532. Suspension of operating privilege. [75 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 1532(c) (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-75/chapter-15/section-1532/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/Z3VH-VFLZ).

question: Other collateral consequences besides the suspension or revocation of a driver's license that may result from a conviction:
answer: Ineligibility for TANF, the General Assistance program, food assistance, and medical assistance for individuals convicted of fraudulently applying to these programs
citations: Pennsylvania Administration Code. Rule 141.21. Eligibility Provisions for TANF/GA. Policy. [55 Pa.Code § 141.21(s)](http://www.pacode.com/secure/data/055/chapter141/s141.21.html). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/6JCE-TEWS).

question: Other collateral consequences besides the suspension or revocation of a driver's license that may result from a conviction:
answer: Loss of voting rights for individuals currently incarcerated for a felony
citations: Department of State. Voting Rights of Convicted Felons, Convicted Misdemeanants, and Pretrial Detainees Brochure. [Voting Rights of Convicted Felons, Convicted Misdemeanants, and Pretrial Detainees](http://www.cor.pa.gov/How%20Do%20I/Documents/Convicted_felon_brochure%20-%20Voting%202016.pdf). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/WJ79-2EKV).

question: Other collateral consequences besides the suspension or revocation of a driver's license that may result from a conviction:
answer: Firearm restrictions
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 6105. Persons not to possess, use, manufacture, control, sell or transfer firearms. [18 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6105(a)(1),(b) (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-18/chapter-61/section-6105/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/GFV4-7AR4).

question: Other collateral consequences besides the suspension or revocation of a driver's license that may result from a conviction:
answer: Denial of the opportunity to adopt
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 6344. Employees having contact with children; adoptive and foster parents. [23 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6344(p)(2) (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-23/chapter-63/section-6344/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/ENL5-DM75).

question: Other collateral consequences besides the suspension or revocation of a driver's license that may result from a conviction:
answer: Removal of child custody rights
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 5329. Consideration of criminal conviction. [23 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 5329(a) (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-23/chapter-53/section-5329/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/3Z9E-U3WE).

question: Other collateral consequences besides the suspension or revocation of a driver's license that may result from a conviction:
answer: Termination of parental rights
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 2511. Grounds for involuntary termination. [23 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 2511(a)(7),(9) (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-23/chapter-25/section-2511/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/3E8L-6AAC).

question: Other collateral consequences besides the suspension or revocation of a driver's license that may result from a conviction:
answer: Loss of veterans benefits
citations: Pennsylvania Administrative Code. Rule 7.11. Grounds for discharge. [43 Pa.Code § 7.11(2)](http://www.pacode.com/secure/data/043/chapter7/s7.11.html). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/7FM5-5SNF).

question: Other collateral consequences besides the suspension or revocation of a driver's license that may result from a conviction:
answer: Deportation
citations: Pennsylvania Consolidated Statutes. 6143. Early parole of inmates subject to Federal removal order. [61 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6143 (2012)](https://law.justia.com/codes/pennsylvania/2012/title-61/chapter-61/section-6143/). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/9CM7-PWXH).

question: Can failure to pay court fees result in the loss of the right to a court-appointed attorney?
answer: No
citations: Pennsylvania Administrative Code. Rule 706. Fines or Costs. [234 Pa. Code § 706](http://www.pacode.com/secure/data/234/chapter7/s706.html). Archived [here](https://perma.cc/T7Q5-S8AX).

question: Types of court fees that may be imposed (list may not be exhaustive):
answer: Probation or supervision fees

question: Types of court fees that may be imposed (list may not be exhaustive):
answer: Electronic monitoring fees

question: Types of court fees that may be imposed (list may not be exhaustive):
answer: Jail usage fees for pre-sentence detainment

question: Types of court fees that may be imposed (list may not be exhaustive):
answer: Conviction fees

question: Types of court fees that may be imposed (list may not be exhaustive):
answer: Administrative fees, including copying and filing fees

answer: Program fees to support offense stopper and safe neighborhood programs

question: Types of court fees that may be imposed (list may not be exhaustive):
answer: Offense-specific fees (e.g., fees related to DUI, domestic violence, or drug-related offenses)

question: Types of court fees that may be imposed (list may not be exhaustive):
answer: DNA testing fees

question: Types of court fees that may be imposed (list may not be exhaustive):
answer: General lab fees

question: Types of court fees that may be imposed (list may not be exhaustive):
answer: Booking fees

question: Court fees are allocated to the following recipients (see statutes for additional details on allocation):
answer: Information not located in statutes
